Text:
Once in the grip of the dazzlingly strong light, Zeta
and Eta are warped to a certain library—

Is this room...an archive? It feels a little
different than the last one.
Perhaps our intent...was the key to the teleport...

...Interesting. So the requirement to make the move
was just thinking like Laugus. A mindset befitting
one of great ability.
So goes my theory...
Now, time for the files...

Eta is drawn toward the mountain of files, perhaps
having realized at a glance how much valuable research
they contain.

*sigh* Never change, Eta... I would say, "Watch out
for monsters," but I don't think she's listening.
Okay, let the investigation begin.
Zeta reaches out for a nearby file as well.
This archive...is very specific.

This isn't reference data used in the investigative
process—it's all conclusions Laugus drew, details
based on truths he arrived at...

I'd love to take all of this back to base...but I
think getting it out of this space won't be easy.
When we teleport, it probably won't—
...Zeta.

Ack?! You startled me! Don't talk to me from behind
like that!
The files here...are kind of strange...
Strange?
Everything here...was carefully selected...
Yeah, I noticed that too.

The ratio of data on topics like the Tears of Diablos
and royal blood...has also decreased...

So maybe Laugus lost interest? Could that have
something to do with his disappearance?

Further in was data on things like the origins of
magic and the genesis of monsters, almost like his
curiosity shifted elsewhere...
What the hell happened...
Oh...and I found this...
Eta produces a well-worn book.
...Is this a journal? Did you check what's inside?
No...I held back... It might be a trap...

Wow, good for you. That's way different than when we
first got here.

I'm not some dunce...who can't learn from her
mistakes...
Zeta... You read it...
Is that what you were really after? Well, not like I mind...
Zeta opens the journal cautiously.
Okay, let’s see...

—O ye of keen mind. That ye are seeing this journal
means that ye are a personage of acumen and
excellence.
So he wrote this...assuming someone would see it?
That is weird, huh... I'll keep going.

—Upon beholding the contents of this chamber, ye may
surmise that the Tears of Diablos no longer hold any
interest for me.

—To be precise...I have decided that I must give
priority to a being greater than the Tears, to
research of a more primordial variety. My concerns
lay...with things far more grand.

—Ye of keen mind. I have faith that one such as ye
will perceive "something" upon beholding what lies
beyond the large door.
—The key to unlock it is—

—"I am a seeker of truth. A pursuer of boundless
knowledge."
This is...the key...
I've got a bad feeling about this...

Something of greater interest than the Tears of
Diablos? What could he mean?

Is there anything that stands out...in the pages of
the journal?
Oh, right. Let's see...

—As it happens, the Cult has been issuing more
orders as of late. It would seem they are displeased
that I have ceased my research on the Tears.

—If I were to continue, I could readily create Tears
of a higher quality. However, I have already
perfected the basic theory. There is nothing so dull
as research where the outcome is already in sight.

—The power of eternal youth has undeniable appeal.
And yet, continuing an inquiry to which I know the
answer lacks any sort of meaning to a scientist
such as I.

—The remaining scientists are more than capable of
handling the rest. Still...I have no doubt the one in
charge will lose a few more hairs due to the stress.
Hahahaha!

And there you have it. I guess most scientists are
kind of weird, huh?

His successor was...Jack Nelson, right? I heard that
he was some bald guy...
A prophet...

...But not like any of that matters anyway. Still,
what's this "something" that caught Laugus's
interest?

I don't know... But the answer is on the other side
of...the big door...
...The let's go and check. We have the key now too.

Zeta and Eta retrace their steps until they are
back before the sealed door.
...We made it back.

Good thing this place is designed to return us to
where we were from the entrance. Now...I'd really
love to input the key we found, but...
What's wrong?

I'd like to draw a conclusion about this place based
on our info up to this point. I feel that if we go
over what we've learned so far, we'll understand what
happened.
So tell me...

I believe the explosion was caused by the remaining
members of the Cult after Laugus absconded.
I see...

Laugus parted ways with the Cult and made his escape
a long time ago. The Cult was in a frenzy to perfect
the Tears, so they would've wanted the leftover
scientists to finish it as quickly as possible.

But perfecting the Tears was too tall an order for
them. They'd been working on it for a thousand years,
nothing that happened should come as a surprise.

Most likely, they continued conducting research here
after taking it over and there was a huge explosion.
They then deserted it before a panic ensued in the
college town, leaving only Laugus's impassable door.
...How'd I do?
The Cult...is a pack of fools...
Can I take that to mean you approve?
Yeah...

Anyhow, without any evidence that Laugus fled, this
is all just guesswork. It's also possible that he
tried to get away and was caught...
I think he actually did...disappear...
Why's that?
Laugus is...like me... I know...how he thought...

For him...the Cult...was the same...as the Shadow
Garden is to me...

A convenient base...for conducting research safely...
A place of unlimited funding...to study whatever we
wish... There is no...sense of belonging involved...
Wow, you really hold yourself that far apart from us?

The principle that governs my behavior is...curiosity
toward the unknown... If something enticing appears
before me...I will pounce on it...
But...
But?
...I have Master Shadow.

I am fascinated by Master Shadow's wisdom.
His wisdom...is what keeps me here...

Not repaying debts...or love for the Garden...
This is how my inquisitive mind works...

That's why I'm certain...about Laugus's behavior...
The proof...is in my affirmation of it...

...I seriously can't make heads or tails of how you
big-brain scientists think. And yet...I believe
you, Eta.
Heh... Then I've made my case...

The two share a glance of mutual respect and then move
in unison toward the large, sealed door.
Now, the key was...
"I am a seeker of truth"—
—"A pursuer of boundless knowledge"...
With the key now spoken, the huge door slowly opens—
